Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 6
Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk devtoolset-4-oprofile
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: new packages: devtoolset-4-oprofile
Vulnerability.Description:
New devtoolset-4-oprofile packages are now available as a part of Red Hat Developer Toolset 4.0 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux. OProfile is a low-overhead, system-wide profiler that uses the performance monitoring hardware on the processor to retrieve information about the kernel and executables on the system. The devtoolset-4-oprofile packages provide the Red Hat Developer Toolset version of OProfile.
This enhancement update adds the devtoolset-4-oprofile packages to Red Hat Developer Toolset 4.0 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux. These packages include OProfile 1.1.0, which is the latest stable release of OProfile. It provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the version included in Red Hat Developer Toolset 3.1, for example:
* The deprecated "opcontrol" and "oprof_start" commands have been removed from OProfile 1.1.0. The "operf" command should be used in their place. The "opreport" command is still used to analyze data stored in the oprofile_data/ directory by the operf tool.
* Support for new Intel processors, such as 6th Generation Intel Core Processors, Intel Xeon Processor D, and Airmont, has been added.
* Fixes have been included to avoid dropping samples from Java programs using Just-In-Time (JIT) translation due to use of anonymous hugepages and changes in the anonymous page mappings.
(BZ#1224359)
All users who require devtoolset-4-oprofile are advised to install these new packages.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
